snippet: The discovery of the teenagers’ bodies in the West Bank prompted vows of retaliation by Israel, which blamed the Palestinian group Hamas for the killings.
abstract: Israel's intense 18-day search for three abducted teenagers ends when their bodies are found buried under pile of rocks in field 15 miles from where they were last seen in occupied West Bank; discovery prompts vows of retaliation by Israel, which blames Palestinian group Hamas for the killings.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Rina Castelnuovo contributed reporting from Halhul, West Bank, and Nof Ayalon, Israel; Nayef Hashlamoun from Hebron, West Bank; Gabby Sobelman from Jerusalem; Fares Akram from Gaza; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The discovery of the teenagers’ bodies in the West Bank prompted vows of retaliation by Israel, which blamed the Palestinian group Hamas for the killings.

headline.main: Israel’s Search for 3 Teenagers Ends in Grief
headline.print_headline: Israel’s Search for 3 Teenagers Ends in Grief
